FitNesse Launcher Plugin

This Maven Plugin directly launches FitNesse integration test server.

Goals Overview

General information about the goals.

  • fitnesse:help Display help information on fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin.
  • fitnesse:set-up Fetches and unpacks FitNesse into a correct working directory structure, and makes sure everything is cleanly setup for running FitNesse. Bound to the 'pre-integration-test' phase.
  • fitnesse:run-tests Goal that runs FitNesse tests using fitnesse.junit.TestHelper. Bound to the 'integration-test' phase.
  • fitnesse:tear-down Cleans up debris after FitNesse runs. Bound to the 'post-integration-test' phase.
  • fitnesse:verify Provides summary report on FitNesse tests run with 'run-tests' goal. Will fail the build if there are test failures. Bound to the 'verify' phase.
  • fitnesse:wiki Launches FitNesse as a wiki server. Useful for manually running / developing / debugging FitNesse tests.
  • fitnesse:shutdown Shuts down FitNesse. This is done by sending GET to http://localhost:<port>/?responder=shutdown.

Usage

General instructions on how to use the Plugin Name can be found on the usage page. Some more specific use cases are described in the examples given below. Last but not least, users occasionally contribute additional examples, tips or errata to the plugin's wiki page.

In case you still have questions regarding the plugin's usage, please have a look at the FAQ and feel free to contact the user mailing list. The posts to the mailing list are archived and could already contain the answer to your question as part of an older thread. Hence, it is also worth browsing/searching the mail archive.

If you feel like the plugin is missing a feature or has a defect, you can fill a feature request or bug report in our issue tracker. When creating a new issue, please provide a comprehensive description of your concern. Especially for fixing bugs it is crucial that the developers can reproduce your problem. For this reason, entire debug logs, POMs or most preferably little demo projects attached to the issue are very much appreciated. Of course, patches are welcome, too. Contributors can check out the project from our source repository and will find supplementary information in the guide to helping with Maven.
